oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Minnie ball and worm and minie ball and ball puller
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: On the left is a .58 caliber minie ball with an iron "worm." On the right is a .58 caliber minie ball with the ball puller shown above it. All of the items were recovered from Sequatchie County, Tenn. and they demonstrate the two methods for removing minie balls from a muzzle loading musket without having to fire the weapon. Both the worm and the ball puller screwed onto the end of a ramrod. They were then inserted into the barrel and screwed into the lead and the ball was pulled out of the muzzle.
